abstract: Lawmakers and budget experts say new federal budget deal will stop steep increase in Medicare premiums for older Americans and large cut in Social Security benefits for disabled workers, but will not change long-term prospects for either program.
lead_paragraph: The budget agreement reached this week will prevent a spike in Medicare premiums and a deep cut in Social Security benefits, experts said, but offers no long-term solution for either program.

headline.main: Agreement Is Seen as Short-Term Relief for Medicare and Social Security
headline.print_headline: Agreement Is Seen as Short-Term Relief for Medicare and Social Security

snippet: The budget agreement reached this week will prevent a spike in Medicare premiums and a deep cut in Social Security benefits, experts said, but offers no long-term solution for either program.
